intro: Escobariopsis carmeniae, commonly known as the Carmen's Escobaria, is a rare and small succulent plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant features spiny stems and produces small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
